column4: is there a way to actively back up my home folder into a separate location on a different HDD in case my current drive fails?
Like Roasted said, lots of ways.  Either write yoruself a backup script, or use backula, or backuppc, or amanda, or any one of the other dozens of backup programs out there.
crontab for timed (every 12 hours), on startup... doesn't ubuntu have an /etc/rc.startup, or something like that.
/etc/rc.local :) put your on-start script in there.
